midas/drivers/bus/wecc32.c

00001 /********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         wecc32.c
00004   Created by:   Pierre-Andre Amaudruz
00005 
00006   Contents:     Device driver for the Wiener CC32 PCI-CAMAC controller
00007                 following the MIDAS CAMAC Standard
00008                 include the 2000 ARW Elektronik source code
00009                 pcicc32.h and libcc32.h for simplicity.
00010 
00011                 Requires module pcicc32.o to be loaded prior the use of
00012                 this driver. For info contact midas@triumf.ca
00013                 
00014   $Log: wecc32.c,v $
00015   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:07  mucap
00016   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00017   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00018 
00019   Revision 1.5  2004/01/08 08:40:08  midas
00020   Implemented standard indentation
00021 
00022   Revision 1.4  2002/02/19 21:56:31  pierre
00023   comments+verified for Kernel 2.4
00024 
00025   Revision 1.3  2001/10/16 20:47:51  pierre
00026   Update cam_interrupt_() args
00027

00029   -Add fe_name
00030

00032   - W-IE-NE-R PCI/CAMAC interface CC32 uses pcicc32.o module, doesn't use dio.

00064 /*--PAA--- inclusion of pcicc32.h for simplicity----------------------*/
00065 #ifndef __PCICC32_H__
00066 #define __PCICC32_H__
00067 /*
00068    pcicc32.h -- the common header for driver and applications for the
00069    PCICC32 PCI to CAMAC Interface from ARW Elektronik
00070 
00071    (c) 2000 ARW Elektronik
00072 
00073    this source code is published under GPL (Open Source). You can use,
00074    redistrubute and modify it unless this header is not modified or deleted.
00075    No warranty is given that this software will work like expected.
00076    This product is not authorized for use as critical component in life
00077    support systems wihout the express written approval of ARW
00078    Elektronik Germany.
00079   
00080    Please announce changes and hints to ARW Elektronik
00081 
00082    first steps                                       AR   25.02.2000
00083 */
00084 
00085 #define PCICC32_MAGIC ' '
00086 typedef struct {
00087    char bConnected;             /* the interface seems to be connected */
00088    char bFail;                  /* a timeout failure is registered     */
00089    char bIrq;                   /* a LAM wants to generate a IRQ       */
00090    char bReserve;               /* not yet used                        */
00091 } PCICC32_STATUS;
00092 
00093 #define PCICC32_IOSTATE _IOR(PCICC32_MAGIC, 1, sizeof(PCICC32_STATUS))  /* get the status of PCICC32 */
00094 #define PCICC32_IOCNTRL _IO(PCICC32_MAGIC, 2)   /* reset a timeout failure, no parameters */
00095 
00096 #endif                          /* __PCICC32_H__ */
00097 
00098 #define pwCC32_ADR(adr, N, A, F) (WORD *)((N << 10) + (A << 6) + ((F & 0xF) << 2) + adr)
00099 #define plCC32_ADR(adr, N, A, F) (DWORD *)((N << 10) + (A << 6) + ((F & 0xF) << 2) + adr)
00100 #define WINDOW_SIZE 32768
00101 
00102 typedef struct {
00103    FILE *f;                     /* the handle of this device */
00104    int fileNo;                  /* equals fileno(f)          */
00105    char *base;                  /* base of range, got with mmap */
00106 } CC32_DEVICE;
00107 /*--PAA--- END of inclusion of pcicc32.h for simplicity----------------------*/
00108 
00109 typedef void *CC32_HANDLE;      /* type of the device handle */
00110 
00111 #define MAX_PCI_ADD 4
00112 
00113 CC32_HANDLE handle[MAX_PCI_ADD] = { NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL };
00114 /*--PAA--- inclusion of libcc32.h for simplicity-------------------*/
00115 int cc32_open(char *cszPath, CC32_HANDLE * handle)
00116 {
00117    CC32_DEVICE *dev;
00118 
00119    *handle = (CC32_HANDLE) 0;
00120 
00121    dev = (CC32_DEVICE *) malloc(sizeof(CC32_DEVICE));
00122    if (!dev)
00123       return errno;
00124 
00125    dev->fileNo = 0;
00126    dev->base = (char *) 0;
00127 
00128    if (!(dev->f = fopen(cszPath, "r"))) {
00129       int error = errno;
00130 
00131       free(dev);
00132       return error;
00133    }
00134 
00135    dev->fileNo = fileno(dev->f);
00136 
00137    dev->base =
00138        (char *) mmap(0, WINDOW_SIZE, PROT_READ, MAP_FILE | MAP_PRIVATE, dev->fileNo, 0);
00139    if (dev->base == (char *) -1) {
00140       int error = errno;
00141 
00142       fclose(dev->f);
00143       free(dev);
00144       return error;
00145    }
00146 
00147    *handle = (CC32_HANDLE) dev;
00148 
00149    return 0;
00150 }
00151 
00152 int cc32_close(CC32_HANDLE handle)
00153 {
00154    CC32_DEVICE *dev = (CC32_DEVICE *) handle;
00155    int error = 0;
00156 
00157    if (dev) {
00158       munmap(dev->base, WINDOW_SIZE);
00159 
00160       if (dev->f)
00161          fclose(dev->f);
00162       else
00163          error = -EINVAL;
00164 
00165       free(dev);
00166    } else
00167       error = -EINVAL;
00168 
00169    return error;
00170 }
00171 
00172 /*--PAA--- END of inclusion of libcc32.h for simplicity-------------------*/

00176 INLINE void cami(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD * d)
00177 {
00178    cam16i(c, n, a, f, d);
00179 }

00181 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00182 INLINE void cam16i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD * d)
00183 {
00184    if (handle[c])
00185       *d = *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00186 }
00187 
00188 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00189 INLINE void cam24i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD * d)
00190 {
00191    if (handle[c])
00192       *d = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00193    *d &= 0xFFFFFF;
00194 }
00195 
00196 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00197 INLINE void cam16i_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00198                      WORD * d, int *x, int *q)
00199 {
00200    DWORD erg;
00201    if (handle[c]) {
00202       erg = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00203       *q = (erg & 0x80000000) ? 1 : 0;
00204       *x = (erg & 0x40000000) ? 1 : 0;
00205       *d = (WORD) (erg & 0x0000ffff);
00206    }
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00210 INLINE void cam24i_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00211                      DWORD * d, int *x, int *q)
00212 {
00213    if (handle[c]) {
00214       *d = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00215       *q = (*d & 0x80000000) ? 1 : 0;
00216       *x = (*d & 0x40000000) ? 1 : 0;
00217       *d &= 0x00ffffff;
00218    }
00219 }
00220 
00221 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00222 INLINE void cam16i_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00223                      WORD ** d, const int r)
00224 {
00225    int i;
00226    if (handle[c])
00227       for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00228          *(*d)++ = *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00229 }
00230 
00231 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00232 INLINE void cam24i_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00233                      DWORD ** d, const int r)
00234 {
00235    INT i;
00236    if (handle[c])
00237       for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00238          *(*d)++ = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00239 }
00240 
00241 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00242 INLINE void cam16i_rq(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00243                       WORD ** d, const int r)
00244 {
00245    WORD erg;
00246    INT i, q;
00247 
00248    if (handle[c])
00249       for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00250          erg = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00251          q = (erg & 0x80000000) ? 1 : 0;
00252          if (q)
00253             *(*d)++ = (WORD) (erg & 0x0000ffff);
00254          else
00255             break;
00256       }
00257 }
00258 
00259 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00260 INLINE void cam24i_rq(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00261                       DWORD ** d, const int r)
00262 {
00263    DWORD erg;
00264    INT i, q;
00265 
00266    if (handle[c])
00267       for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00268          erg = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, n, a, f);
00269          q = (erg & 0x80000000) ? 1 : 0;
00270          if (q)
00271             *(*d)++ = (erg & 0x00ffffff);
00272          else
00273             break;
00274       }
00275 }

00423 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00424 INLINE int cam_init(void)
00425 {
00426    unsigned char status;
00427    unsigned int adr, error;
00428    int i;
00429    char fname[16];
00430 
00431 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00432    printf(" Board not supported under this OS\n")
00433 #endif                          // _MSC_VER
00434 #ifdef OS_LINUX
00435        for (i = 0; i < MAX_PCI_ADD; i++) {
00436       if (handle[i]) {
00437          printf("Crate[%d] already in use\n", i);
00438          continue;
00439       }
00440       sprintf(fname, "/dev/cc32_%1d", i);
00441       if ((error = cc32_open(fname, &handle[i]))) {
00442          cm_msg(MERROR, "cam_init", "wecc32: Crate[%d] not found (%s)", i, fname);
00443          handle[i] = NULL;
00444       } else
00445          printf("cam_init: wecc32: open device %s handle:0x%x \n", fname, handle[i]);
00446    }
00447 #endif
00448    for (i = 0; i < MAX_PCI_ADD; i++)
00449       if (handle[i])
00450          return SUCCESS;
00451    return FE_ERR_HW;
00452 }
00453 
00454 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00455 INLINE void cam_exit(void)
00456 {
00457    INT i;
00458 
00459    for (i = 0; i < MAX_PCI_ADD; i++)
00460       cc32_close(handle[i]);
00461 }

00464 INLINE void cam_inhibit_set(const int c)
00465 {
00466    if (handle[c])
00467       *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 27, 0, 16) = 0;
00468 }
00469 
00470 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00471 INLINE void cam_inhibit_clear(const int c)
00472 {
00473    if (handle[c])
00474       *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 27, 1, 16) = 0;
00475 }

00480    if (handle[c])
00481       *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 0, 0, 16) = 0;
00482 }

00491 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00492 INLINE void cam_lam_enable(const int c, const int n)
00493 {
00494    DWORD mask;
00495    if (handle[c]) {
00496 //    printf("c%d n%d ", c, n);
00497       mask = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 1, 0);
00498       mask &= 0xffffff;
00499 //    printf("mask 0x%x ", mask);
00500       mask |= (1 << (n - 1));
00501 //    printf("Enable mask:0x%x ",mask);
00502       *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 1, 16) = mask;
00503       mask = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 1, 0);
00504 //    printf("Final Enable mask:0x%x\n", mask);
00505    }
00506 }
00507 
00508 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00509 INLINE void cam_lam_disable(const int c, const int n)
00510 {
00511    DWORD mask;
00512    if (handle[c]) {
00513       mask = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 1, 0);
00514       mask &= ~(1 << (n - 1));
00515       *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 1, 16) = mask;
00516    }
00517 }
00518 
00519 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00520 INLINE void cam_lam_read(const int c, DWORD * lam)
00521 {
00522    if (handle[c]) {
00523       *lam = *plCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 2, 0);
00524       *lam &= 0xffffff;
00525    }
00526 }
00527 
00528 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00529 INLINE void cam_lam_clear(const int c, const int n)
00530 {
00531    if (handle[c]) {
00532       /* station F10 */
00533 //      *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *)handle[c])->base, n, 0, 10) = 0;
00534       /* CC32 */
00535       *pwCC32_ADR(((CC32_DEVICE *) handle[c])->base, 28, 0, 16) = 0;
00536    }
00537 }
